      • FileToStringArray

        public static java.lang.String[] FileToStringArray(java.lang.String fileName,
                                                   java.lang.String inputCharacterSet)
                                            throws java.io.IOException
        This method converts a file into a corresponding array of strings, in such a way that each string of the array corresponds to a certain line in the input file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - name of the input file
        inputCharacterSet - character Set to be used for reading the input file
        Returns:
        an array of String objects, each corresponding to a line in the input file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the operation can not be carried out appropriately

      • FileToHashMap

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> FileToHashMap(java.lang.String fileName,
                                                                                 java.lang.String inputCharacterSet)
                                                                          throws java.io.IOException
        This method converts a file into a corresponding mapping from Strings to Strings, in such a way that each tab-separated pair of strings in a line of the input file corresponds to an element of the mapping.
        Parameters:
        fileName - name of the input file
        inputCharacterSet - character Set to be used for reading the input file
        Returns:
        a hash map that maps strings to strings
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the operation can not be carried out appropriately

      • FileToStringArray

        public static java.lang.String[] FileToStringArray(java.lang.String fileName,
                                                   char specialSymbol,
                                                   java.lang.String inputCharacterSet)
                                            throws java.io.IOException
        This method converts a file into a corresponding array of strings, in such a way that each string of the array corresponds to a certain line in the input file. Lines starting with a certain specified symbol will be discarded.
        Parameters:
        fileName - name of the input file
        specialSymbol - the special symbol indicating that a line should be ignored
        inputCharacterSet - character Set to be used for reading the input file
        Returns:
        an array of String objects, each corresponding to a line in the input file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the operation can not be carried out appropriately

      • FileToStringArrayAndSort

        public static java.lang.String[] FileToStringArrayAndSort(java.lang.String fileName,
                                                          java.lang.String inputCharacterSet)
                                                   throws java.io.IOException
        This method converts a file into a corresponding array of strings, in such a way that each string of the array corresponds to a certain line in the input file. Additionally the array is sorted lexicographically.
        Parameters:
        fileName - name of the input file
        inputCharacterSet - character Set to be used for reading the input file
        Returns:
        an array of String objects, each corresponding to a line in the input file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the operation can not be carried out appropriately

      • readLinesFromBuffer

        public static void readLinesFromBuffer(StringArrayList list,
                                       java.io.BufferedReader reader,
                                       int max)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Reads lines from a given BufferedReader into a StringArrayList
        Parameters:
        list - the list in which the lines from the buffered reader will be stored
        reader - input buffered reader
        max - the maximum number of lines that will be read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the operation can not be carried out appropriately

      • readMarkedStringsFromBuffer

        public static void readMarkedStringsFromBuffer(StringArrayList list,
                                               java.io.BufferedReader reader,
                                               int max,
                                               char separator)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Reads strings from a given BufferedReader into a StringArrayList Strings are separated by given character (end-of-string marker). If the separator does not appear, all remaining lines in a buffer will be treated as a single string.
        Parameters:
        list - - an output string array list
        reader - - a buffered reader to read from
        max - - maximal amount of multi-lines to be read
        separator - - a char representing a separator
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the operation can not be carried out appropriately

      • readMarkedStringsFromBufferWithoutSeparators

        public static void readMarkedStringsFromBufferWithoutSeparators(StringArrayList list,
                                                                java.io.BufferedReader reader,
                                                                int max,
                                                                char separator)
                                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Reads strings from a given BufferedReader into a StringArrayList (avriant)
        Parameters:
        list - - an output string array list
        reader - - a buffered reader to read from
        max - - maximal amount of multi-lines to be read
        separator - - a char representing a separator
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the operation can not be carried out appropriately

      • readStringFromBuffer

        public static void readStringFromBuffer(java.io.BufferedReader reader,
                                        java.lang.StringBuffer buffer,
                                        char separator)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Reads lines from a given BufferedReader unless a line ending with a given symbol (separator) appears, and appends all lines read so far to a given string buffer. If the separator does not appear, all remaining lines in a buffer will be read and appended to the string buffer
        Parameters:
        reader - - an input BufferedReader
        buffer - - a string buffer for storing the lines
        separator - - a char representing a separator
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the operation can not be carried out appropriately

      • writeLinesToBuffer

        public static void writeLinesToBuffer(StringArrayList list,
                                      java.io.BufferedWriter writer,
                                      int max)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Writes lines (including end of line symbols) from a given StringArrayList to a BufferedWriter.
        Parameters:
        list - the list of strings from which the strings will be written to the buffered writer
        writer - buffered writer
        max - the maximum number of lines that will be written
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the operation can not be carried out appropriately

      • writeStringsToBuffer

                                        int max)

        writer - buffered writer
        max - the maximum number of lines that will be written
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the operation can not be carried out appropriately

        Parameters:

        Reads a file into a String.
        Parameters:

        charSet - character set to be used
        Returns:
